title: ss_insignia
body:
Any form of [[Waffen-SS]] [[insignia]] that either indicate rank, "division or units.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Waffen-SS_units It came in various form, such as [[collar tabs]], ([[shoulder patch|shoulder]]) [[patch]]es, [[Reichsadler]] or [[Totenkopf]] [[hat ornament]], [[cuff title]] and [[shoulder boards]]. [[Red armband|Red]] [[armband]]s and [[Nazi party pin]]s are optional.
The most recognizable ones are the [[siegrunen|two Sieg runes]] and heraldic shield bearing specific symbol of certain division, such as crossed [[Stielhandgranate|stick grenades]] of the Dirlewanger Brigade (post #6434101).

h1. See also
* [[Black Sun (symbol)]]
* [[swastika]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]

title: black_sun_(symbol)
body:
A symbol derived from the ancient German mark of the [i]Sonnenrad[/i] or "[[Sun symbol|Sun]] wheel". It was used by the [[Waffen-SS]] in their [[building]]s and installations during [[World War II]].

The symbol's design consists of a [[circle]] with twelve radial [[siegrunen|sig runes]]. It first appeared in [[Nazi]] Germany as a design element in a castle at Wewelsburg remodeled and expanded by the head of the SS, [[Heinrich Luitpold Himmler|Heinrich Himmler]], which he intended to be a center for the SS.

h4. See also
* [[swastika]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]
* [[Totenkopf]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Black Sun (symbol)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sun_(symbol)]

title: hanazuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hanazuki[/i]. Character designed by [[Shirokitsune]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]], [[fox ears]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[pink kimono]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], a dark [[red hakama]] with [[hip vent]]s and a [[floral print]], [[hair flower]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudders]] in place of the heels. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 100 mm twin gun mounts placed one to each side, 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], her funnel to her back, and a [[parasol]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #3876962: Default
* !post #3876961: [[hanazuki_(morning_moon_beachside_flower)_(azur_lane)|Morning Moon, Beachside Flower]]
* !post #5089018: [[hanazuki_(blossoming_spring_resplendent_moon)_(azur_lane)|Blossoming Spring, Resplendent Moon]]

h4. History
In real life, she was built as a further simplification of the [i]Akizuki[/i]-class design to save production time, she was commissioned in late December 1944 but saw no action. She was allocated to the United States Navy as a war prize and given the hull number DD-934 before being scuttled in 1948.

He serves as one of Koko's bodyguards and snipers. His ex-wife is [[Chequita (jormungand)|]].

title: aurora
body:
A natural atmospheric phenomenon that causes a pattern of colorful lights to appear in the [[night sky]].

Predominantly seen in high-latitude regions around the Arctic and Antarctic. Also known as the [b]northern lights[/b] or [b]aurora borealis[/b] in the Northern hemisphere and as the [b]southern lights[/b] or [b]aurora australis[/b] in the Southern hemisphere.

title: medic_(tf2)
body:
[i]When the patient woke up, his skeleton was missing, and the doctor was never heard from again! ...Anyway, that's how I lost my medical license.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Dr. Ludwig.

A German man of "medicine" hailing from a lineage of mad scientists from Stuttgart, Germany (although very explicitly not a Nazi). A twisted doctor and biologist who generally considers the healing he provides an unintentional side effect of sating his own curiosity, he is known to have experimented on his teammates in bizarre, occasionally helpful ways. Despite his utter lack of morals, he provides invaluable healing for his team, and has been shown to care about them on some level, though how much of it is as his guinea pigs is debatable. Owns and cares for a number of pet [[dove]]s, chief among which is his most beloved pet, [[Archimedes (tf2)|]]. Often paired with [[Heavy (tf2)|the Heavy]], both for their gameplay synergies and in fanart.

The Medic's most important weapon is his [[medi gun]], a ramshackle tube-shaped device that projects beams of healing energy to his team. Once his medi gun has built up enough power, he can unleash the "Ubercharge", causing his patient to become fully invincible for a short period of time, shown by them becoming metallic and glowing their team's color. He also carries a [[syringe]] gun for self defense, and a [[bonesaw]] as a melee weapon. He has several alternative versions of each weapon, most notably the Crusader's Crossbow, a [[crossbow]] that fires large syringes.

The Medic's default outfit includes a large light-colored [[coat]] with buttons, team-colored rubber [[gloves]], a thick black [[belt]], black [[boots]] over team-colored pants, small round [[glasses]], and a mechanical [[backpack]] that connects to his medi gun.

Voiced by [[Robin Atkin Downes]].

title: engineer_(tf2)
body:
[i]How am I gonna stop some big, mean motherhubbard from tearing me a structurally superfluous new behind? The answer? Use a gun. And if that don't work? Use more gun.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Dell Conagher.

An amiable, soft-spoken good ol' boy from Bee Cave, Texas, with 11 hard science PhDs and a decade of experience in the oilfields. Like his father and grandfather before him, the Engineer specializes in inventing and constructing machines and devices, from the mundane to the scientifically fantastical. Shown to be the most laid-back and friendly of the team, although his mad scientist streak comes out in the heat of combat, as shown when he willingly cut his own hand off to wield a prototype prosthetic. Odd friends with [[Pyro (tf2)|the Pyro]], and the mortal enemy of [[Spy (tf2)|the Spy]].

The Engineer supports his team by constructing three buildings: the [[sentry]] gun that automatically fires on enemies, the [[dispenser (tf2)|]] that provides health and ammunition to his allies, and the [[teleporter]] which lets them quickly travel. His [[wrench]] is used as both a melee weapon and as a means to upgrade his buildings, and he carries a [[shotgun]] and [[handgun]] for personal defense, as well as various alternatives for each. One notable alternative is the Gunslinger, a [[single_mechanical_hand|mechanical hand]] that allows him to build "mini" sentry guns.

The Engineer's default outfit includes a yellow [[hard hat]], black [[goggles]], black [[overalls]] over a team-colored shirt, a thick [[belt]] with several pouches, yellow [[knee pads]], and black [[boots]]. He also wears one yellow rubber [[gloves|glove]] that hides the Gunslinger, and often carries his buildings in a team-colored [[toolbox]] when on the field.

title: sapper
body:
[i]Spy sappin' mah dispenser/sentry/teleporter.[/i]
-- [[Engineer (tf2)|]]

[[Spy (tf2)|]]'s default building weapon in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It can neutralize enemy [[dispenser (tf2)|dispensers]], [[sentry|sentry guns]], and/or [[teleporter|teleporters]], and destroy them.

body:
[i]Need a dispenser here![/i]

A machine in [[Team Fortress 2]] that can be built by [[Engineer (tf2)|]]. Allies near it get ammunition, health, and metal to aid in their mission.

title: black_box_(tf2)
body: An unlockable primary weapon for [[Soldier (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. Players can regain 20+ health on every successful hit at the cost of a smaller clip size. It is modeled after an M202 FLASH.

title: widowmaker_(tf2)
body: An unlockable primary weapon for [[Engineer (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is modeled after the [[Widowmaker TX]] from [i]Deus Ex: Human Revolution[/i]. It uses the Engineer's metal reserve rather than regular ammunition, and damage done to an enemy or enemy building will return metal to the player's ammo pool.

title: hearts_of_iron
body:
A series of grand strategy games set during [[World War II]] developed by Paradox Interactive. The games allow users to alter the course of the war via various means, from Germany winning the war to Japan joining the Allies.

The fourth entry in the series, Hearts of Iron IV, especially has been successful, due to its greater accessibility compared to its predecessor, and greater ease of modding, resulting in feature-rich mods which may even completely transform the scenario.

h4. See also

* [[Kaiserreich]]
* [[The New Order: Last Days of Europe]]

title: kansaiben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in the Kansai / Kinki region in Japan.

Kansai dialect is typified by the speech of Osaka, the major city of Kansai, which is referred to specifically as Osaka-ben. It is characterized as being both more melodic and harsher by speakers of the standard language.

This accent is often translated to a southern US accent in English.

title: steve1989mreinfo
body:
Steven Thomas, known online as Steve1989MREInfo or Steve1989, is an American YouTuber and military ration commentator.

Steve began his YouTube channel in November 2015 and first gained notoriety in January 2016 for a video in which he ate 61-year-old peanut butter from a Korean War-era Meal, Ready-to-Eat (MRE). Later that year, a video review of Steve eating American Civil War-era hardtack from 1863 went viral.

Despite eating rations that are well beyond the recommended shelf life specified by Natick Laboratories and other manufacturers, Steve has reported that he rarely becomes ill, though he did contract E. coli and had to be hospitalized in 2015, ironically from a ration that was actually within its shelf life.

h4. External Links
* "YouTube: Steve1989MREInfo":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2I6Et1JkidnnbWgJFiMeHA]

title: kyuudou
body:
Traditional Japanese [[archery]] is called Kyuudou (弓道). The [[bow_(weapon)|]], called a [[yumi (bow)|]], is constructed in a very special way such that it can be easily used while riding on a horse. This is done by modifying the design of the bow itself such that the main point of recurve on the bow is below its center.  

The bow itself will be quite long, yet the arrow is still fired in the same manner as the English long bow; its main difference being the lower firing position and the bow usually extend several feet above the archer's head.

Women are frequently seen wearing a breastplate while practicing; this is a [[muneate]]. Its purpose is to protect the breasts from the snap of the bow string when it is fired.

h4. Examples

* !post #6527902

h4. See also

* [[muneate]]
* [[yugake]]
* [[yumi (bow)|]]

title: hibiscus
body:
A flowering plant in the [i]Malvaceae[/i] family. Arguably the most popular tropical flower.

Commonly represented by [i]Hibiscus rosa-sinensis[/i], also known as [b]Chinese hibiscus[/b] and [b]Hawaiian hibiscus[/b]. It has five wide petals and a prominent long pistil covered with stamens near the tip. Common colors include pink, red, orange, yellow, shades of purple and white.

Makes the perfect accessory as a [[hair flower]] for a [[bikini]]/[[swimsuit]].

title: crt
body:
A CRT (cathode-ray tube) is a display technology used in [[television]]s and computer [[monitor]]s, before LCDs and plasma displays replaced them. Characteristically fat and boxy.

While abandoned by most consumers for being much more heavy and large than other types of displays at comparable screen sizes, CRTs are still appreciated by some enthusiasts and professionals for their superior color reproduction, lack of input lag, and lack of native resolution.

Short for "Print Club", Purikura is a term for machines that take pictures of people's faces or figures and print them onto stickers. On the Pixiv platform, it also refers to a tag for artworks designed to resemble these stickers.

It was invented by ATLUS, and "Purikura" and "Print Club" are now registered trademarks of Sega, but the term "Purikura" is colloquially used to refer to similar products from other companies as well.

title: american_psycho
body:
A black comedy-horror novel by [[united_states|American]] writer Bret Easton Ellis, published in 1991. It was adapted into a 2000 film directed by Mary Harron and starring [[Christian Bale]] in one of his pre-[[Batman Begins]] roles.

It is a satirical psychological thriller that delves into the dark and disturbing mind of [[Patrick Bateman]]. The story is set in the 1980s during the height of the yuppie culture in [[new york city|New York City]]. It follows the perspective of Patrick Bateman, a wealthy investment banker, as he navigates his high-powered job, materialistic lifestyle, and his double life where he engages in supposed acts of extreme violence, murder and sadism. 

The novel is known for its graphic and explicit descriptions of violence, consumerism, and the shallow nature of 1980s society. It has sparked controversy and debate since its release and has been adapted into a film in 2000.

The film was considered a box-office disappointment but has since developed a large cult following. The film experienced a revival of popular interest in the 2020s due to its strong presence in contemporary meme culture, typically centered around Bateman's perceived "sigma" personality. 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho]
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film)]

h4. See Also

* [[Patrick Bateman]]

title: destoroyah
body:
A draconic [[kaiju]] from the [[Godzilla (series)|]] series, first appeared in [[Godzilla vs. Destoroyah]].

Originally a primordial microscopic organism born 2.5 billions years ago during the Precambrian period, where earth is still lacking in oxygen. Destroyah was awakened from stasis after the usage of [[Oxygen Destroyer]] bomb against the original [[Godzilla]] in 1954. After being exposed to enriched oxygen due to excavation work, Destroyah rapidly evolved to massive size.

title: homework
body:
Assignments that [[teacher]]s give to students to finish at home. These can be short-term questions or long-term projects, but both are due by a certain deadline.

For Japanese students, one of the noteworthy homework is that in the summer vacation. They take this long vacation in the middle of the Japanese school year (starting in April), so teachers give them some amount of homework. You should work on it little by little, or you end up with the homework hell in the end of the vacation.

h4. See also

title: orc
body:
A [[monster|monstrous]] humanoid creature, semi-intelligent and usually aggressive. Very prevalent in fantasy universe stories and video games.

Their appearance varies (even more so if they are half-orcs), but usually they have a [[muscular]] or [[fat]] build, [[green skin|green]] or [[grey skin]], large [[tusks]], and [[pointy ears]]. [[Female orc]]s are often depicted as [[tall female|tall]], [[muscular female|muscular]], and voluptuous with [[large breasts]]. In Japanese fantasy art, male orcs are often also given [[pig|piglike]] [[snout]]s, pig/wild [[boar]] head or simply [[pig ears]].

Orcs are usually depicted as an arch-enemy to [[elf|Elves]], and are very frequently paired with them in NSFW works.

h4. See also

* [[female orc]]
* [[ork (warhammer)|]] (this tag is used for orcs in [[Warhammer 40k]])
* [[ogre]]
* [[oni]]
* [[troll]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: hatsuharu_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The kai/retrofit form of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Hatsuharu (Azur Lane)|]]. 

Upon retrofit, she casts aside her grey sweater to reveal a [[sleeveless]] [[midriff]] white top with a [[white sailor collar]], while her skirt turns [[white skirt|white]] with a [[side slit]]. She also gains white [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[long sleeves]] with a "mountain stripe pattern" reminiscent of the Shinsengumi, with the colors inverted.
Her rig is also larger and more mechanical, attached on the waistline, carrying two 12.7 mm twin gun mounts and a single 61 cm triple torpedo mount. Also attached to the rig is a [[katana]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #3729047
other_names: 初春改(アズールレーン)

title: kasshoku_musume_no_latina-san_ni_ore_no_karada_ga_nerawarete_iru
body:
A light novel by Kiraku Kishima, with illustrations by [[Oryo (oryo04)|]].

The announcement of the light novel went viral on Twitter after being shared by Manga Mogura, with the title [i]"The Dark Brown Latina Girl Is Aiming For My Body"[/i], initially due to the absurdity of the scenario. 

The initial "title" was later revealed to be mistranslated, with the title indicating that the main female protagonist was called "[[latina olavomiwa|Latina]]" (ラティーナさん as opposed to ラテン系). The illustrator affirmed she was called "Latina", and later the author revealed that she was an indigenous Amazonian from Brazil, and that her name was a result of him asking AI for "the most typical South American female names".
other_names: 褐色娘のラティーナさんに俺の体が狙われている

title: tensei_shitara_slime_datta_ken
body: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime (Japanese: 転生したらスライムだった件, Hepburn: Tensei Shitara Suraimu Datta Ken) also known as TenSura (転スラ) or Slime Isekai is a Japanese fantasy light novel series written by Fuse, and illustrated by Mitz Vah about a salaryman who is murdered and reincarnates in a sword and sorcery world as a slime with unique powers and gathers allies to build his own nation of monsters.

title: frima_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of [[Cafe Sweety (nikke)|]] together with [[Sugar (Nikke)|]] and [[Milk (Nikke)|]].

The leader of Cafe Sweety, who sells cream coffee. Her inherent laziness actually leads her to discover the most efficient ways to get things done.

title: clay_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of [[Rewind (nikke)|]] Squad, a team comprised of cheerleaders. 

Acts as the head hype woman who is responsible for jazzing up the crowd. Bright and lively.

Having grown up idolizing [[Bay (Nikke)|]], Clay relentlessly strives to achieve her dreams.

h4. Official art
* !post #7725398: Default

title: bay_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Captain of [[Rewind (nikke)|]], the Ark's cheerleading squad, consisting of her and [[Clay (Nikke)|]].

Suffers from scopophobia, but becomes very enthusiastic when it comes to cheering someone on.

Captain of the cheerleading squad Rewind. When she gets in the zone and cheers someone on, no one can motivate like she can.
Bay's dream is for her spirited cheers to touch every corner of the Ark.

h4. Official art
* !post #7432698: Default

title: gochuumon_wa_usagi_desu_ka?
body:
A [[4koma]] slice-of-life manga by [[Koi (koisan)|]], serialized in Houbunsha's [[Manga Time Kirara|Manga Time Kirara MAX]] since 2011. Abbreviated as "gochiusa" and localized as "Is the order a rabbit?". The story follows characters' café jobs and school life in a Europe-themed Japanese town home to many rabbits. h4. title: naoi_ayato
body:
An [[Angel Beats!]] character. He has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He is the Vice President of the Student Council, and is normally seen wearing a black [[gakuran]], black [[pants]], and a [[black hat]]. 

Voiced by [[Ogata Megumi]].

title: cast_away
body:
Cast Away is a 2000 American survival drama film directed and co-produced by Robert Zemeckis and starring [[Tom Hanks]], Helen Hunt, and Nick Searcy. The film depicts a FedEx employee stranded on an uninhabited island after his plane crashes in the South Pacific and his desperate attempts to survive on the island using remnants of his plane's cargo. 

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia: Cast Away":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cast_Away

title: balan_wonderworld
body:
A platforming video game developed by Arzest and Balan Company, published by [[Square Enix]], and released for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]], [[Nintendo Switch]], and [[computer|PC]] on March 26, 2021.

Despite seemingly having a dream team behind the game with [[Sonic (series)|]] creator Naka Yuji helming the project as director, [[Ooshima Naoto]] providing original character designs, and Square Enix's trademark CGI cutscene quality, the game was largely criticized upon release due to it's questionably simple gameplay, useless powerups, and subpar level design.
other_names: バランワンダーワールド

title: candy_apple
body:
Also known as [b]Toffee apple[/b], in Commonwealth English.

A whole [[apple]] covered in a hard sugar candy coating, [[caramel]], or [[chocolate]]. Candy apples are a common treat at [[autumn]] [[festival]]s such as [[Halloween]].

It is easy to mistake a candy apple for a red [[lollipop]] due to artists drawing a candy apple spherical. So take notice of the surroundings, flat bottom/top and size of the candy.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22761715

h4. See also

* [[Tanghulu]], Chinese candied fruit stick.
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Candy apple":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Candy_apple]

title: luna_(arcaea)
body:
A side story Partner in [[Arcaea]]. Twin sister of [[eto_(arcaea)|Eto]].

Luna is described in the game as a merciless girl. She also does not feel friendly and affable to other people as well, while daring people to play her challenge, Singularity.

She is much more affectionate towards her twin sister, Eto, however, as shown in their side story.

title: ein_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]].

A very young girl with pure [[white skin]], [[orange eyes]] with [[x-shaped pupils]], with an [[extra pupils|extra pupil]] in one of her eyes, [[white hair|white]], [[medium hair|shoulder length]] hair styled into [[twintails]].

She usually wears a [[white coat|white]] [[bottomless]] [[open coat|open]] [[off-shoulder coat|off-shoulder]] [[coat]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]] that could reach [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]]. Other notable features include her black, [[mechanical tail]], [[respirator]] and [[mechanical hands]].

Often seen together with [[Ohr (Blue Archive)|]] and [[Sof (Blue Archive)|]].
other_names: アイン(ブルーアーカイブ)
アイン・ソフ・オウル(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: emoji
body:
Emoji are Unicode characters designed to represent pictograms and [[emoticon|emoticons]]. The term itself, however, is most often used to refer to the pictograms and emoticons themselves. The word "Emoji" comes from the Japanese word "絵" ([i]e[/i], "picture") + "文字" ([i]moji[/i], "character"). Its resemblance to the word "emoticon" is purely coincidental.

Emoji as we know them originated as a proprietary system by a Japanese mobile phone operator [[NTT DoCoMo]] using a Unicode private-use block to encode their emoticons. While other mobile providers used many other systems for emoji, this system was the most compact implementation used at the time (and the closest to the current one).

The very first Emoji were actually Unicode Dingbats, of which, quite a few are now official Emoji. Emoji became a standardized system with its implementation in Unicode 6.0 in 2010 but it's only around 2014-2015 that their use exploded and became commonplace to the point that they became a cultural phenomenon with real world merchandise and even a movie about them.

h4. List of emoji

* 😈 [[demon emoji]]

title: morse_code_commentary
body:
A [[commentary]] written in [[morse code]].

It is recommended to decode (translate) the code into English, as there are different types of text encoding.

title: cyrillic_commentary
body:
A [[commentary]] written in [[Cyrillic]]. Not recommended due to redundancy and impossibility of unambiguous definition.

Use this tag only when it is either impossible to unambiguously determine the language (comments from one character or several unrelated characters, or as part of other languages), or when the Cyrillic in question is used for a non-Cyrillic-using language.

Otherwise, put only the language tag, such as:

* [[Russian commentary]]
* [[Serbo-Croatian commentary]]
* [[Ukrainian commentary]]

h4. See also

* [[symbol-only commentary]]
* [[mixed-language commentary]]

title: yankumi_covering_for_her_student_who_faps_to_blue_archive_(meme)
body:
Japanese copypasta meme featuring [[Gokusen]] character [[Yamaguchi Kumiko]] (nicknamed Yankumi) verbally defending one of her students who masturbates to [[Blue Archive]] girls. First surfaced in July 2022 and soon spread like wildfire to various Japanese image boards and social media. Then people started uploading animated music videos on Nico and Youtube.

Note that this is not canon, but a fanon meme.

h4. Original copypasta

Original JP:

[quote]待たせたな。

お前ら笑うなっ！

こいつは
誰も知らねぇとこで、

毎日ブルーアーカイブで
過酷なオナニー
してんだよっ！

お前らは毎日
ブルーアーカイブで
オナニーして、

精子出してんのか？

出してねぇやつは

笑うなっ！[/quote]

Translation:

[quote]

Kept you waiting, huh.

DON'T YOU GUYS DARE LAUGH!

He's been fapping away real hard in secret to [[Blue Archive|Blue Archive]] every day!

Do you guys even fap to Blue Archive every day and cum?

If you don't then DON'T LAUGH!

[/quote]

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うヤンクミ":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%96%E3%83%AB%E3%82%A2%E3%82%AB%E3%81%A7%E6%8A%9C%E3%81%84%E3%81%9F%E7%94%9F%E5%BE%92%E3%82%92%E5%BA%87%E3%81%86%E3%83%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%82%AF%E3%83%9F]
* "Youtube: [音MAD] ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うアルティメットセンセイ [コメント付き]":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BqDKIuCkEQs]
other_names: ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うヤンクミ
ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うアルティメットセンセイ

title: kitagawa_yuusuke
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]] (JP) / [[Matthew Mercer]] (EN).

A second year student at Kosei High School, with a unique artistic talent and the star pupil of [[Madarame Ichiryuusai|a famed Japanese-style artist]]. He is particularly focused on his artistry, often to the detriment of his own well-being. His initial Persona is [[Goemon (Persona 5)|]].

title: solid_circle_pupils
body:
Wide open, circular eyes with large, solid black, circular pupils (◉‿◉). May depict shock, creepiness, or a [[wide-eyed]] [[staring|stare]]. Often seen in [[Muppo]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6904977

h4. See also

* [[._.]]
* [[o_o]]
* [[O_O]]
* [[solid circle eyes]]
* [[solid oval eyes]]
* [[wide oval eyes]]
* [[sacabambaspis]]
* [[sanpaku]]

Eyes drawn as vertical solid white ovals with a thick black rim. Used to express [[surprised|surprise]]. Similar to [[o_o]], except oval shaped instead of circular.

If the eyes form horizontal ovals, use [[wide oval eyes]] instead. If the eyes form circles, use [[o_o]] instead. If the eyes are solid black, use [[solid oval eyes]] instead.

These are not tagged [[blank eyes]].

title: koi_koi_cafe_(ensemble_stars!)
body:
An event story in [[Ensemble Stars!]], released on Jan 30th 2024. It's 6 chapters long and features [[Shino Hajime|Hajime]], [[Himemiya Tori|Tori]], [[Tenshouin Eichi|Eichi]] and [[Shiina Niki|Niki]].

[quote][i]"Niki makes some highly-nutritious cookies that contain a rare plant for Tori. 
Tori immediately has Eichi eat them — however, the plant has the ability to make those who eat it "fall in love"…"[/i][/quote]

For characters that have this event's outfit as an [[official alternate costume|canon alternate outfit]], see one of the following:

* [[Himemiya Tori (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Shiina Niki (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Tenshouin Eichi (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Shino Hajime (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]

This tag also encompasses characters [[cosplay|cosplaying]] the clothing in this event as an [[alternate costume]], as well as canon and non-canon depictions of the event.

title: mizu_happi
body:
A mizu [[happi]] is a type of [[Japanese clothes]] worn during a [[Shinto]] [[festival]] by those carrying the yamakasa, a type of float. It consists of a [[fundoshi]] and a small cloth jacket tied together from the front with a knot. Due to the revealing nature of the clothes, men are the ones to wear them, though women are often drawn wearing them for fanservice reasons.

h4. Examples

title: cable_knit
body:
A knitting style that features textured three dimensional overlapping layers that usually either look like a braided cable or rope, a lattice of repeating Xs, a chain, or other similar interlocking pattern.

[[Aran sweater]]s prominently feature this knit style, to the point that almost the entire sweater is comprised of various types of cable knitting. The [[virgin killer sweater]] also usually features cable knitting.

h4. Examples

* !post #3345233: Cable knit [[Aran sweater]]
* !post #2962620: A sweater that is both [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] and cable knit
* !post #3415232: A lattice cable knit
* !post #3463461: Cable knit hat
* !post #2532992: Cable knit mittens
* !post #2507157: Cable knit hat, mittens, and scarf

h4. See also

* [[sweater]]
* [[aran sweater]]
* [[virgin killer sweater]]
* [[ribbed sweater]]

body: A 2017 television series airing on FX. Based in the [[X-Men]] [[x-men film series|continuity]], it follows David Haller, also known as Legion, a powerful mutant with schizophrenia.

title: nightgown
body:
A nightgown, nightie or nightdress is a loosely hanging item of nightwear, today almost exclusively worn by women.

A nightgown may have any neckline, and may have sleeves of any type, or be sleeveless, and any shoulder strap or back style. The length of a nightgown may vary from hip-length to floor-length. A short nightgown can be called a "shortie" or a [[Babydoll]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3825422

* [[Babydoll]]

title: chest_sarashi
body:
A [[sarashi]] worn around the chest area. This sarashi style is typically worn in the style of a [[tube top]], in which the bandages wrap around only the chest area in a very nontraditional way while leaving the [[midriff]] bare. This sarashi style is especially seen on kendo girls and other fighters and is a more common form of sarashis worn by female characters in anime and video games.

title: enna_alouette_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Enna Alouette]]. 

It consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]], [[purple dress|purple]] [[multicolored dress|and]] [[blue dress|blue dress]] with a pair of [[white pantyhose|white]] [[pantyhose]] and a pair of [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]] on (sometimes she streams with her [[bare legs|bare legs]] and [[barefoot|feet]].) She also wears [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish|nails]] on.

From her full costume, she also wears a [[white hood]] with a [[black bowtie|black]] and [[green bowtie]], extended [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[long sleeves|long sleeves]] with [[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlets]] and [[fur bracelet|fur bracelets]]. title: barbell_piercing
body:
A type of [[piercing]] jewelry that is composed of a straight bar and with a bead on each end.

One or both beads are unscrewable for removal and/or changing of the beads. Often one of the beads is fixed, either via epoxy or welding, so that only one bead is used to install or remove the jewelry. 

There are also variations of the barbell piercing. Most common are [i]curved barbells[/i] (mostly used for [[navel piercing|navel piercings]]), [i]circular barbells[/i] and [i]surface bars[/i] which are used in surface piercings.

title: hakama
body:
Traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]], looking like either a [[pleated skirt]] ([[hakama skirt]]) or baggy, pleated [[pants]] ([[hakama pants]]). A traditional hakama has seven deep pleats, five in the front and two in the rear.

Hakama are split into a front and back section at the top, each of which have ties which are secured around the waist, often with visible [[hip vent]]s and usually covering the midriff. Hakama are worn over a [[kimono]].

Commonly worn both by [[samurai]], [[miko]] and [[kannushi]], practitioners of many martial arts including [[kyuudou]], and often by [[sumo]] wrestlers when appearing in public outside the ring.

Traditionally worn by men with either a [[kataginu]] sleeveless jacket/vest in an outfit known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower) or over a formal, long-sleeved [i]montsuki[/i] [[kimono]], with the family crest on it.  Sometimes a [[haori]] is worn over the latter.

Hakama are also commonly worn by both female college students and female teachers or professors at graduation ceremonies because during the late 19th and early 20th centuries they were the standard female school uniform until the introduction of the [[serafuku]]. Also during this time period they were a fashionable day to day outfit for young women, often paired with a kimono with a simple geometric or floral print. Women's hakama tend to be either solid color or with a graduated hue, and hakama meant for young women may be sparsely decorated with floral decorations, they are paired with a solid color kimono.

h4. Examples

* !post #2982627: [[hakama pants]]
* !post #7662672: [[hakama shorts]]
* !post #6238172: [[long skirt|Long]] [[hakama skirt]]
* !post #2782322: [[hakama short skirt]]

title: tokino_sora_(old_design)
body:
The old designs of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokino Sora]]. This tag is for all her pre-2018 base appearances, and all of her various outfits before June 2019.

Since her debut in September 2017, she has had several iterations of her base design and 3D model, each including their own outfits and accessories. Counting changes to her default appearance, until her updated base model was revealed in June 27, 2019, she had a staggering [i][b]13[/b][/i] outfits! They were, in order, her September 2017 debut model, her October 2017 updated model, her 2017 Halloween outfit, her 2017 Christmas outfit, her 2018 New Years outfit, her quiz show outfit from January 2018, her 2018 Valentine's outfit, her 2018 base model outfit (which established the base of her current default), a red outfit from June 2018, her 2018 Halloween outfit, her 2018 Christmas outfit, her 2019 New Years outfit, and her 2019 Valentine's outfit.

title: tenkai_tsukasa
body:
An independent [[Virtual YouTuber]] and leader of the group [[BANs]]. His initial design was created by [[Magura Ene]], while his current illustrator is [[K-SUWABE]]. 

He started his activities on June 2, 2018 soon after [[Bitou Kaiji]] ceased activities. Since then, he has frequently collaborated with various VTuber groups and independents, including a brief period as a participant in the [[Nijisanji]] NetWORK program alongside [[Fairys (vtuber)|]]. Though no longer officially affiliated with the company, he still participates in events such as Nijisanji Koushien. 

His most defining features are his irises shaped like the design on the 1 Pin [[mahjong tile]] and his [[red hair]], [[sunglasses]], [[dice earrings]], and [[track jacket]] emblazoned with the BANs logo. Like Bitou Kaiji, he also has a び ([i]bi[/i])-shaped scar on his cheek.

title: super_sonico
body:
The [[mascot]] character of "NITRO SUPER SONIC", annual live events held by the company [[Nitroplus]]. She made her debut in 2006 and she was designed by [[Tsuji Santa]]. She is the vocalist & guitarist of the band "[i]Daiichi Uchuu Sokudo[/i]" (第一宇宙速度, First Cosmic Velocity) and the other members are bassist [[Fujimi Suzu]] and drummer [[Watanuki Fuuri]].

Sonico is rather shy and clumsy, but nevertheless kind, bubbly, energetic and positive no matter what. Her usual (and most known) outfit consist of a [[casual]] [[blouse]] with a cat printed on it, as well as a [[blue hoodie|blue]] [[hoodie]], and a [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[miniskirt]]. She is never seen without her trademark [[headphones]]. While her physical features depend on the artist, she is consistently depicted with large, [[tareme|droopy]] [[red eyes]], [[pink hair|light pink hair]] and very [[large breasts]].

Her height is 158cm, and her measurements are 90F-57-87. Her birthday is October 14th.

On June 30th, 2018, Sonico "announced":https://twitter.com/sonico_macaron/status/1012578566343573504 her debut as a [[virtual youtuber]], which lasted until January 2020. Her redesign consists of a [[pink jacket|pink]] and [[white jacket|white]] [[letterman jacket]], her trademark cat blouse or a [[camisole]] (depending on what kind of straps are on her shoulders), a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a pair of [[black legwear thighhighs]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[high heel boots]].

Sonico has a brother figure and male counterpart in [[nitro+ chiral|nitro+CHiRAL]]'s mascot [[Naitou-kun]].

body:

It functioned akin to activ8's virtual talent support 'group', [[project upd8]], where ENTUM aided its endorsed VTubers with the creation of content, planned collaborations and events, served as spokespersons for the media and provided a physical address for fans to send correspondence.

ENTUM would shut down at the end of 2019, with its talents either also retiring, going independent, or finding new agencies.

title: breast_band
body:
Single rectangular strip of fabric (or other material) wrapping around the breasts to minimally cover the areolae and nipples.

Differs from a [[tube top]] and a [[bandeau]] in that a [[breast band]] does not offer full coverage of the breasts and must reveal [[underboob]] and [[sideboob]] to be considered a [[breast band]]. The fabric from a [[breast band]] should comparatively only barely cover the areolae and nipples while being a perfectly rectangular strip.

Differs from a [[strapless bra]] and a [[strapless bikini]] in that the fabric does not form cups for the individual breasts and remains a single continuous strip of fabric that tightly secures the breasts.

[[Sarashi]]s are not [[breast band]]s unless it is a single strip of fabric (as opposed to multiple overlaid strips as is usual for a [[sarashi]]).

[[Belt bra]]s are not [[breast band]]s.

title: kizuna_ai_(chinese)
body:
Chinese-installed [[Kizuna AI]], introduced during Kizuna's birthday event on June 30th, 2019. The fourth AI introduced as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019, she also has a different voice actress, but, unlike the other two, had her own design from the start.

She represents A.I.Channel on bilibili, but also manages the spin-off YouTube channel "A.I.Channel China". She is handled by different producers in collaboration with [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] and their license.

On December 4th, 2019, alongside her fellow AIs, she asked viewers for an official nickname. She would later announce the nickname on December 19th, "revealing":[https://youtu.be/pNzTV9Wc8c4] it to be "AI-ge" (爱哥) (= AI-bro or AI-aniki).

h4. External links

* Youtube Channel: "A.I.Channel China":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCArUdy5xj0i0cTuhPHRVMpw] | "Debut":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SXq7JMfpPuU]
* Bilibili Spaces: "AIChannel中国绊爱":[https://space.bilibili.com/484322035] | "哎咿多工作室":[https://space.bilibili.com/11673035]
* Twitter: "@KizunaAIChina":[https://twitter.com/KizunaAIChina]

title: ai-pii_(kizuna_ai)
body:
The third AI to join Kizuna AI, as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019.

Initially referred to as AI #3 (and unofficially nicknamed 好きぴ (Sukipi)), to differentiate the differently-voiced AI from the original, when not wearing the default attire, she'd wear the [[kizuna_ai_(a.i._games)|A.I.Games]] outfit to further distinguish herself. By December, as to make it easier to distinguish them, she received a * hairclip and became known as "AI-pii":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WQ-MErCNOMQ].

In May 2020, it was announced that she would be receiving her own Twitter account, and that she'd be joining [[love-chan (kizuna ai)|]] in a new shared YouTube channel, called the [[love-pii channel]]. On June 13th, she finally received a unique design.

Following the release of the love-pii song Uinatsu on September 13th, AI-pii ceased her activities at Kizuna AI Inc. "effective":[https://twitter.com/KizunaAIinc/status/1306128297261068288] from September 16th.

h4. External links

* Youtube Channel: "love-pii channel":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYm8zALd2uHqyy6C1tb4_zA] | "Debut":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I17_ia2vqX0]
* Twitter: "@aipii_lp":[https://twitter.com/aipii_lp]

title: love-chan_(kizuna_ai)
body:
The second AI to join Kizuna AI, as part of the Multiple AI Project, starting from May 2019.

Initially referred to as AI #2 (and unofficially nicknamed キュール (Kyu-ru)), to differentiate the differently-voiced AI from the original, when not wearing the default attire, she'd wear the [[kizuna ai (elegant)|Elegant]] outfit to further distinguish herself. By December, as to make it easier to distinguish them, she received a # hairclip and became known as "love-chan":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sp0n12L3Fo0].

In May 2020, it was announced that she would be receiving her own Twitter account, and that she'd be joining [[AI-pii (kizuna ai)|]] in a new shared YouTube channel, called the [[love-pii channel]]. On June 13th, she finally received a unique design. From September 25th onward, she became the solo host of the channel, renamed "love channel". After Ai-chan went on hiatus in February 2022, Love-chan became one of the main representatives of the brand, which remained the case until May 2024, when she graduated from [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] and became an indie under the name "love=charmulet".

title: hanakuma_chifuyu
body:
A mascot character for TOKYO6 ENTERTAINMENT, along with [[Koharu Rikka]] and [[Natsuki Karin]]. She is planned to have a talking voicebank on the [[CeVIO]] engine and a singing voicebank on the [[Synthesizer V]] engine.

She is officially illustrated by [[Teshima Nari]] and has long black hair in [[side braids]], [[green eyes]], and [[glasses]]. She wears a school uniform consisting of blue [[blazer]], blue [[miniskirt]], [[green necktie]] and [[green vest]].

She is a 1st year student at the fictitious [[otaru_(hokkaido)|Otaru]] Shiokaze Highschool along with her fellow classmates and club members 2nd year [[Koharu Rikka]] and 3rd year [[Natsuki Karin]]. Her birthday is on March 2nd. She is voiced by [[Okuno Kaya]].

title: tsukishita_kaoru
body:
Former [[Virtual YouTuber]] and member of [[Holostars]] from the third batch, [[TriNero]]. A fledgling makeup artist with a deep voice contrasting his feminine appearance. As he loves cosmetics and cute things, he's trying to keep himself beautiful as well. Kaoru presented himself in a cute and bubbly manner, however, he would be perverted and also made dirty jokes sometimes. He is a huge fan of [[Beyblade]] and was adamant about adding that into his 'interests' section, or else "it's the same as leaving his soul behind".

His [[Beyblade]] ASMR stream was trending 1st place on Twitter in Japan after the stream was "noticed by Beyblade creator Takara Tomy":[https://twitter.com/takaratomytoys/status/1263679986554138624].

After three months of activities, he graduated on July 28, 2020 due to undisclosed personal circumstances.

He takes a distinctly [[otoko no ko|feminine-looking appearance]] with his [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], though it is actually a [[wig]] - his true hair is much [[short hair|shorter]]. He has [[swept bangs]] and [[purple eyes]]. His outfit includes a [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]], [[black jacket]], [[brown shorts]], [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. He also wears a [[black hairband]] with a [[black bow]] and yellow [[x hair ornament]] attached to it.

title: orion_(constellation)
body:
Orion is an equatorial [[constellation]], named after the mythological hunter Orion in Greek mythology. Its brightest stars are [[Betelgeuse (star)|]], part of the "Winter triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Triangle, and Rigel, part of the "Winter Hexagon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Hexagon.

Orion is one of the brightest and most easily recognizable constellations. Its 7 brightest stars form an hourglass "[b]⟩⟨[/b]" shape with red Betelgeuse at the top left and blue Rigel at the bottom right. At the center of the shape lies a 3-star asterism known as the "[i]Belt of Orion[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/orionsbelt.html, beneath which lies another asterism called the "[i]Sword of Orion[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/swordoforion.html (see post #8405 for reference). In addition to the hourglass shape, other stars in the constellation form patterns that depict a stick figure of Orion with one arm holding a bow (in other interpretations, a shield or hide) and the other arm raised (in other interpretations, holding a club or sword).

h4. Examples

* !asset #21778243: The hourglass shape

title: auriga_(constellation)
body:
Auriga (the Charioteer) is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Capella, which is part of the "[i]Winter Hexagon[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Hexagon.

Auriga forms a pentagon or hexagon, sometimes depicted with a triangle. It shares a star with [[Taurus (constellation)|]] (the Bull), so they are often depicted together.

title: yakushiji_suzaku
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] and first-generation member of [[Holostars]]. His appearance seems intimidating, but he’s a cheerful, playful man who enjoyed messing with people. He also has something of a comedic sociopathic streak, when he realized he could get rid of everyone in [[Japan]] to turn it into an uninhabited island that he wanted. FPS games were his specialty.

Retired on March 6th, 2020 without a reason, though fans guess it was due to low engagement. As he graduated before Holostars started receiving attention, information about him is scarce, not helped by his channel removing all of his archives upon [[Tsukishita Kaoru]]’s own retirement.

He has [[white hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] and [[yellow eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[unbuttoned shirt|unbuttoned]] [[collared shirt]], [[black undershirt]], [[black pants]], a [[red kimono|red]] [[kimono on shoulders]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]]. He also wears an [[omamori]] on his [[belt]] and a [[gold bracelet|gold]] [[bead bracelet]]. He carries a [[katana]] called Shuchoumaru.

title: kagami_kira
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber]] and first-generation member of [[Holostars]]. Despite his cute appearance, Kira's conversation topics occasionally veer into perverted territory the most among the Holostars, and he once even conducted a [[cucumber]]-eating [[ASMR]] stream. He normally speaks in a cutesy, effeminate voice, but can drop it by several octaves to the point where it has been described as being similar to [[kira yoshikage|Yoshikage Kira]] if he wants to. He is a skilled gamer, and usually played [[Apex Legends]] with [[Astel Leda]] and [[Kanade Izuru]]. 

He graduated on November 30, 2020 due to his mental and physical health issues. 

Kira is an [[otoko no ko]] who has [[aqua eyes]] and [[messy hair|messy]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[aqua hair]] tied up into a [[twintails]]. His bangs is [[swept bangs|swept]] to the left, and there is an [[ahoge]] on his head. 

His default costume consists of a [[wing collar|wing-collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] [[crop top]] that exposes his [[midriff]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[aqua skirt|aqua]] [[pleated skirt]] and a [[short necktie]] of the same color and patterns, as well as a [[white coat|white]] [[hooded coat]] decorated with [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] and has [[polka dot]] and plain yellow [[sleeve cuffs]]. He wears [[black footwear|black]] [[thighhighs]] [[platform boots|platform]] [[thigh boots]], a [[black belt]], and a [[plaid headwear|plaid]] [[pillbox hat]] with [[rabbit]] and [[heart hat ornament]]. There are several [[hairclip|hairclips]] on his hair and [[brooch|brooches]] on his collar.

title: engineering_nonsense
body:
Like [[anatomical nonsense]], but for engineering. A depiction of [[machinery]], [[vehicle focus|vehicles]], [[weapon|weaponry]], etc. that clearly defies common sense for comedic effect. This does not apply to simply impractically large fictional weapons; it represents an intentional and exaggerated disregard for both actual physics and science fiction conventions.

For badly drawn [[vehicle]]s that are results of [[artistic error]]s, use [[bad vehicle anatomy]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4086062

h4. See also

* [[anatomical nonsense]]
* [[rube goldberg machine]]
* [[what]]

title: millennium_ring
body:
One of the seven Millennium Items from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. It has an ability to guide its owner to whatever they seeks, including another Millennium Items. As well as an ability to manipulate and sealing one's soul inside other object.

It is a dreamcatcher decorated with a triangular plate at the center and five prongs at the bottom, to which the user worn the item like a necklace.

It is possessed by [[Bakura Ryou]], whose the item would corrupted him into his evil self known as [[Yami Bakura]] [spoiler]due to it possessing the soul of the evil spirit [[Zorc Necrophades]][/spoiler].

title: millennium_eye
body:
One of the seven Millennium Items from [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] in the shape of a golden eyeball. It was notably posessed by [[Pegasus J Crawford]], who wore it in place of his left eye.

Granted the user the "Mind Scan" ability, allowing them to read the thoughts of others.

title: yamaguchi_momoe_(singer)
body: Momoe Yamaguchi is a Japanese former singer, actress, and idol whose career lasted from 1972 to 1980. Born in 1959 and often simply referred to by her given name "Momoe", Yamaguchi is one of the most successful singers in Japanese music, releasing 32 singles, including four number one hits (Fuyu no Iro in 1974, Yokosuka Story in 1976, Pearl Color ni Yurete in 1976, Yume Saki Annainin in 1977), and 21 studio albums. She also starred in 15 feature films and several television serial dramas.

title: han_chi_ho
body:
South Korean [[Virtual Youtuber]] from [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Nijisanji KR|Korean branch]] and formerly part of [[541 E&C]].

Graduated on April 4, 2022.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4699447

h4. Profile

Chiho is an old Taoist [[wizard]] and legendary storyteller who was sealed in the past and revived in modern times. As a Taoist wizard, Chiho exterminates youkai but he currently only exterminates those that are actively attacking humans. Because of this, Chiho was able to adapt to the streaming environment quickly. Rather than performing his powers, he found that he wanted to adapt quickly to modern culture and fit in with people. He started streaming after finding out that in modern times, one can communicate with people from further away through streaming.

body:
The player character of [i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i].  Will be called [b]Anzu[/b] by default and is referred to as such in the supplementary materials. In-game statements say that she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

After transferring to Yumenosaki Academy, Anzu becomes the sole female enrolled in the Producer program and is the only female in the school at all. She manages the various idols obtained throughout the game. She's described as a no-nonsense and straightforward girl who's also a workaholic.

It's hinted that she may be the elder sister of the [i][[Ensemble Girls!]][/i] [[protagonist (ensemble girls!)|]], given that her characteristics match what the protagonist says about their sister. 

[spoiler]In truth, she used to be a student in the school from [i]Ensemble Girls![/i], and her pen name was "Angie". She was also friends with [[Kuromori Suzu]]. Anzu was the leader of a resistance which planned to oppose the school's strict methods. After being betrayed by [[Itou Sakura]] and the student council (especially [[Enjouji Reika]]), who encouraged the students to bully Anzu, she was forced to transfer to Yumenosaki, starting the events of [i]Ensemble Stars![/i].[/spoiler]
other_names: あんず(あんさんぶるガールズ!)

title: belldandy
body:
Belldandy is a character in the [[Aa Megami-sama]] manga/anime series. She is the middle of three goddesses who come to Earth to reside with [[Morisato Keiichi]], and serves as his primary love interest. Initially, Keiichi thinks that her offer to grant him a wish was a prank by his senpai so, he makes a joke asking her to stay with him forever. However, Belldandy actually grants the request as a legitimate wish, and soon enough her sisters show up to see what's going on. 

Her older sister is [[Urd (aa megami-sama)|]], although they only share the same father, making them half sisters. Despite that, both she and her younger sister, [[Skuld (aa megami-sama)|]] don't seem to mind that, and treat Urd as if they were full blooded sisters. Belldandy's younger sister looks up to her "oneesama" as Belldandy seems to be the ideal goddess, although it should be noted that despite her sweet and gentle personality, Belldandy can be quite competitive and even shows signs of jealousy whenever someone gets too close to Keiichi. Still, the vast majority of the time, Belldandy remains calm and also displays a rather mature personality, even more so than some of the older goddesses and demons in the series.

Voiced by [[Inoue Kikuko]].

h4. See also
* [[Verdandi]], one of the Norns in Norse mythology which inspired Belldandy.

title: blue_cheese
body:
Any variety of cheese that incorporates edible mold. 

Easily identifiable by the spots of blue mold on the interior or exterior of the cheese.

title: wedding_dress
body:
A marital [[dress]], typically all [[white dress|white]] and decorated with [[frills]] and [[veil|veils]].

Wedding dresses in nonstandard colors should be tagged using the dress color tags. For example, a pink wedding dress should be tagged as [[wedding dress]] and [[pink dress]].

h4. Related tags

* [[bridal veil]]
* [[bridal gauntlets]]
* [[elbow gloves]]

body: Ruggie Bucchi is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Savanaclaw. He assists [[leona_kingscholar|Leona]] as his junior. Due to having grown up in a poor environment, he's a bit of a glutton.

title: neck_flap
body:
Headwear with a flap on the back; also called a flap cap or a neck cape. 

Typically used as a sunshield in everyday use. Specialized headgear may also cover protection against rain, wind and debris.

title: soviet_school_uniform
body:
A [[Soviet]] era girls' [[school uniform]], in use from 1949 to 1992 (after 1984 only for those under 16). Easily mistaken by outsiders as a maid uniform.

Usually accompanied by white frilly bows, and a [[Pioneer neckerchief]], which almost all schoolchildren under the age of 14 wore.

h4. External links

* "IRL photo":[https://twitter.com/rxs318/status/1384841646383247364]

title: mushroom_cloud
body:
A large distinctive mushroom-shaped cloud of debris/smoke and commonly water vapor from a large-scale scale explosion.

Most commonly associated with [[nuclear weapon]]s, but can also be caused by conventional explosives of significant power and natural events like certain types of volcanic eruptions and impact events.

If the explosion were implied to be caused by nuclear device, or that the typical characteristic of nuclear explosion were present (such as superheated atmosphere), also apply the tag [[nuclear explosion]].

title: pioneer_neckerchief
body:
The traditional [[red neckerchief]] worn by someone in the [[Pioneer movement]], adapted from the [[Scout uniform]]. Known in East Asia as the "red scarf".

Can also be found as part of the Girls' [[Soviet School Uniform]].

title: nuclear_powerplant
body:
A thermal [[power plant]] in which the heat source is a [[radiation_symbol|nuclear]] reactor. 

As is typical of thermal power stations, heat is used to generate [[steam]] that drives a [[steam]] turbine connected to a generator that produces [[electricity]].

h1. See also

* [[tag group:locations]]

title: wind_chime
body:
Also called a wind-bell, the wind chime is a decorative object suspended in midair that has three basic forms:
* A cluster of small pieces of metal, glass, pottery, bamboo, seashell, or wood that collide with each other and make noise when blown by the [[wind]]
* A cluster of tubes or rods, often made of metal or wood, that are rung by a central clapper, to which is attached a flat plate to catch the wind
* A single [[bell]] or open-ended glass globe whose clapper is attached to a flat plate to catch the wind. 

h4. See also

* [[wind chime focus]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_chime
"Encyclopedia Britannica article":https://www.britannica.com/art/wind-bell

title: breakdance
body:
A style of acrobatic dancing originating in the mid-1970s, often performed to rap music usually by teenage males in the streets, and characterized by intricate footwork, pantomime, spinning headstands, tumbling, and elaborate improvised virtuosic movements.

Became an official sport during the [[2024 summer olympics|Paris Olympics]] under the name "breaking." Canada's Philip "Phil Wizard" Kim and Japan's Yuasa Ami won gold medals in their respective events.

title: broly_(dragon_ball_z)
body:
Originally an anime-only character designed by [[Toriyama Akira]], serving as the main antagonist of [[Dragon Ball Z]] Movie 8, [i]Broly: Legendary Super Saiyan[/i], and Movie 10, [i]Broly: Second Coming[/i], with a variation of the character, [[Bio Broly]], serving as the antagonist of Movie 11, [i]Bio-Broly.[/i] He is the son of [[Paragus (dragon ball z)|]].

His most identifying visual elements include:
* pre-transformation: the [[circlet]] and [[armlet]]s, golden, with the former having a blue [[forehead jewel]]; medium-to-long black or brown hair
* constant: [[gold earrings|golden]] [[hoop earrings]], golden [[bracer]]s/[[vambraces]], and the [[gold necklace|golden]] [[necklace]], the latter two having a blue gem embedded in it; [[white pants]] paired with a red robbed material, [[gold footwear|golden]] [[boots]], [[topless male]] and a [[monkey tail]]; scars on [[scar on chest|chest]] and [[scar on stomach|stomach]] (only if based on DBZ Movie 10).
* post-transformation: incredibly [[muscular]] body, [[spiked hair|spiked]] blonde or green hair, based on scene ([[Legendary Super Saiyan]]), [[no pupils]]

Finally appeared in canon form with the release of Movie 20, [i][[Dragon Ball Super Broly]][/i] in late 2018, [[Broly (Dragon Ball Super)|redone]] under Toriyama's supervision.

title: union_jack
body:
Also known as the [b]Union Flag[/b], it is the name given to the national [[flag]] of the [[United Kingdom]]. It is a combination of three different flags: the red St. George's Cross of England, the white St. Andrew's Cross of Scotland, and the red St. Patrick's Cross of Ireland.

The design of the Union Jack consists of a blue field, known as the Union Flag, with a red diagonal cross (St. Patrick's Cross) that extends from corner to corner. This cross represents [[Ireland]]. Superimposed on the diagonal cross are two intersecting crosses. The upright red diagonal cross (St. George's Cross) represents [[England]], and the white diagonal cross in the shape of an "X" (St. Andrew's Cross) represents [[Scotland]].

The Union Jack's design was first created in 1606 when England and Scotland were separate kingdoms but shared the same monarch, King James VI of Scotland and I of England. The flag was officially adopted in 1801 after the Act of Union, which united the Kingdom of Great Britain (combining England and Scotland) with the Kingdom of Ireland.

Also appears in the national flags of [[Australia]], [[New Zealand]], [[Fiji]], and [[Tuvalu]], as well as those of British colonies and territories. It is also on the flag of the American state of [[Hawaii]].

This may be confused with a mecha from [[Gundam 00]] called a [[Union Flag]] used by the world superpower Union in the series.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Union Jack":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Flag]
* "Wikipedia: Flag of the United Kingdom":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom]
* "The Royal Family: Union Jack":[https://www.royal.uk/union-jack]

title: roundel
body:
A typically circular symbol. The term is used in heraldry, but also commonly used to refer to a type of national insignia used on [[military]] [[aircraft]], generally circular in shape and usually comprising concentric rings of different colours.

Notable examples:

* United States has circle with a white star, with two white or white-and-red bars on the left and right side.
* Japan has a single red circle, mostly bordered with white stylized after the Japanese flag.
* Germany has a black [[iron cross]] with white borders.
* Britain has a blue, white, and red circle.
** Canada, Australia, and New Zealand replace the circle with a maple leaf, a kangaroo, and a kiwi bird respectively.
* France has a red, white, and blue circle.
* Italy has a red, white, and green circle. During World War II, it has white circle bordered in black with three black fasces in it.
* Soviet Union had a five-pointed [[red star]] with white border. Belarus also uses this roundel after the collapse of the USSR, while Russia added blue border between the white and red section.
* China also has a red star, but with a Chinese text meaning "8.1" and bordered by two red yellow-bordered bars.
* Taiwan and the former Republic of China uses [[Kuomintag]] "white sun" symbol" contained within blue circle.
* Sweden has a blue circle bordered in yellow with three gold crowns in it.
* Poland has a red and white checkerboard design.
* South Korea has a red and blue yin-yang bordered with three black bars on either side.
* Israel has a blue six-pointed star on a white circle.
* Indonesia has a white red-bordered pentagon design.
* The Philippines has a blue, white, and red diamond with wings.
* Finland has a white, blue, and white circle design. Formerly, they used a blue swastika on a white circle.


h4. See Also
* [[Balkenkreuz]]
* [[Nose Art]]
* [[Red Star]]
* [[Rising Sun Flag]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Roundel":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roundel

title: armageddon_bomb
body:
Lit. "Planet Destruction Bomb"

A "gadget" from [[Doraemon]]. Essentially an [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] that [[Doraemon (character)|]] occasionally brings out when he goes mad or insane (especially when he sees a [[rat]]). Primarily serves as comic relief within the series.

Since the bomb only rarely appears, it's never explained why Doraemon possesses such a weapon despite that fact that he is supposed to be a "babysitting robot". The bomb is also never used in any more serious situations (such as life-threatening moments in the various Doraemon movies), mainly due to the kid-oriented theme of the series.

On Danbooru, the bomb is tagged as a [[nuclear weapon]], because when "the manga chapter":[http://doraemon.wikia.com/wiki/Chapter_115:Mouse_And_Bomb] was first serialized in 1974, the gadget was actually called a nuclear bomb.

title: it_should_have_been_me_not_him_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a scene from the English dubbed version of the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters|Duel Monsters]] anime. The original scenes involves [[Yami Yugi]] dejectedly beating the ground and shouts "It should have been me, not him! It's not fair!", blaming himself for losing the shadow duel to [[Rafael (Yu-Gi-Oh!)|]] and causing the soul of [[Muto Yugi]] to be sealed inside the card instead of him.

While the context of the original scene is that Yami Yugi is blaming himself for Yugi being punished by his failure, in meme context, the character is instead being shown to be [[envy|envious]] of someone's good fortune.

title: shuumatsu_nani_shitemasu_ka?
body:
[i]Shuumatsu Nani Shitemasu ka? Isogashii desu ka? Sukutte Moratte Ii desu ka?[/i]; abbr. [i]Sukasuka[/i] is a Japanese light novel series written by Kareno Akira and illustrated by [[ue]].

A sequel series, [i]終末なにしてますか？ もう一度だけ、会えますか？[/i] ([i]Shuumatsu Nani shitemasu ka? Mou Ichido dake, Aemasu ka?[/i]; abbr. [i]Sukamoka[/i]) started in April 2016.

Although the series' english cover text is "Do you have what THE END? Are you busy? Shall you save XXX?", a more accurate translation of the title would be "What are you doing at THE END? Are you busy? Will you save me?"

A manga adaption by [[Seu Kaname]] started in July 2016.

An anime adaption by Satelight aired in April 2017.

* [[Willem Kmetsch]]
* [[Chtholly Nota Seniorious]]

h4. External links

* "Novel official website":http://sneakerbunko.jp/series/shumatsu/
* "Anime official website":http://sukasuka-anime.com/
* "Kareno Akira's personal website":http://kareno.moo.jp/index.php
* "Character reference by Kareno Akira":http://kareno.moo.jp/works/sukasuka/materialNoteForRevealation.html

body:
Either:

title: pogo_stick
body:
A jumping device made of a metallic stick with springs somewhere inside, and two footrests at the stick's base. Users stand on the footrests and use the springs to create a bouncing motion. The origins of the word 'pogo' is debated, but it's possible that its modern-version inventors Hans Pohlig and Ernst Gottschall (1920, Germany) combined the first two letters of their surnames to create the word.

Some modern designs have modified the springs or even replaced them altogether, such as with compressed air or a bow mechanism, and have achieved jumping heights of 6 feet or more (1.8 meter+).  This has lead to the growth of using pogo sticks in an extreme sport and the development of the sport "extreme pogo" or "xPogo."

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pogo stick":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pogo_stick

title: momoe_nagisa
body:
A character from [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i], introduced in the [[mahou shoujo madoka magica: hangyaku no monogatari|third movie.]]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] in [[two side up|two sides up]] and [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] [[ringed eyes]]. Her regular clothes is a [[sailor dress]] with [[polka dot dress| polka dots]] and a [[pantyhose]]. She is very fond of [[cheese]].

In her [[magical girl]] form, she wears a [[capelet]] with [[suspenders]], [[fingerless gloves]], a [[beanie]] with [[pom_pom_(clothes)|poms poms]] and [[fake animal ears]], a [[fur trim]]  and a [[bubble skirt]] with a [[polka dot legwear|polka dot]] pantyhose. Her weapon is a [[trumpet]] that can release explosive [[bubble]]s.  

[spoiler]She is actually the original magical girl who became the witch [[Charlotte (Madoka Magica)|Charlotte]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also

title: charlotte_(madoka_magica)
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character.

The [[witch_(madoka_magica)|witch]] that [[Tomoe Mami]] battles [spoiler]and lost[/spoiler] in episode 3, and has two forms; the first is a limp stuffed doll-like creature wearing a cape, the second is a massive black worm with multicolored eyes.

Charlotte is a dessert witch who is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, but is unable to make the [[cheese]] that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese. She is also very tenacious, and never gives up. Charlotte's minions are [[pyotr (madoka magica)|Pyotr]].

[spoiler]It is confirmed that [[Momoe Nagisa]], a character introduced in the third movie, is Charlotte's human form.[/spoiler]

[[Danny (jojo)|]] from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] is a Harlequin Great Dane. [[Scoobert Doo]], the eponymous character of the [[Scooby-Doo]] series, is designed after the breed as well.

body:
A breed of [[dog]] originating from France bred for herding, and were used by the French Army as a messenger, sentry and to search for missing soldiers during World War I. They have a large body and shaggy brown, black or tawny fur that tends to cover the eyes.

In popular culture, [i]Dennis the Menace[/i]'s dog Ruff is a Briard. Also, [[Chewbacca]] from [[Star Wars]] fame was modeled after the Briard.

title: mahou_no_princess_minky_momo
body:
A manga and anime series written by [[Shudo Takeshi]] starring [[Minky Momo]], a [[magical girl]] who does not fight against villains but rather gives people hope and dreams with her magic. The series is divided into two eras: the "Sora Momo" (空モモ - Sky Momo) series that aired in 1982, and the "Umi Momo" (海モモ - Sea Momo) series that aired in 1991. The two Minky Momos look the same, but are completely different.

The series became infamous after the airing of episode 46 of the first season, in which Minky Momo dies after being hit by a truck. Soon after that, an urban legend arose that this episode caused earthquakes across Japan.

title: doven_wolf
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]AMX-014 Döven Wolf[/b]

A revolutionary unit developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]] from a captured Federation [[Gundam Mk V]] prototype MS. It is loaded with a massively powerful reactor, a huge mega-launcher rivaling even the [[zz_gundam|Double Zeta Gundam]]'s high-mega Cannon, INCOMs and a quasi-psycommu system which allowed even non-Newtypes to execute the deadly all-range attack. All at the cost of less armor.

A few units ended up in the hands of the [[Earth Federation]] after the [[gundam_zz|First Neo Zeon War]], where they were converted into the [b][[silver_bullet_(mobile_suit)|ARX-014 Silver Bullet]][/b] for testing and evaluation, and many others found themselves in the hands of the Sleeves, painted in their traditional markings.

It was [[Rakan Dahkaran]]'s final mecha of choice.

title: round_teeth
body:
A wide, [[open mouth|open-mouthed]] [[smile]] where the front [[upper teeth only|upper teeth]] are drawn as a single round semicircle.

Often, it is reserved for depictions of youthfulness, playful personality, and innocence, and is very often a recurring physical trait in certain characters (as with [[Mizuno Kaede]] and [[Aoi Sora (pairan)|]]). However, it is common enough that it might show up without any qualifiers.

Differs from [[buck teeth]] in that buck teeth describes only the two upper front teeth, or a something that resembles just those two front teeth, while round teeth describes the entire row of front upper teeth.

h4. Examples

* !post #2091083
* !post #3775180

title: corset
body:
A form-fitting garment, worn around the waist and fastened with laces.

True corsets provide back support with sturdy columns of steel or (historically) whalebone and may be cinched to compress the abdomen for a [[curvy]] figure. Corsets were traditionally considered underwear, but in modern times are sometimes worn above the clothing, particularly in fetish fashion. Many such outerwear corsets have flimsy or no boning and thus are not rigid enough to support or reshape the body.

Corsets are usually an [[underbust]] garment, covering only the stomach and waist, but overbust designs for breast support also exist.

Not to be confused with the similar-looking [[bodice]], which reaches up to or over the breasts and often has sleeves or arm holes.

h4. Examples

* !post #5747197

* !post #7293832

h4. See also

However, this tag is [i]very infamous[/i] for being frequently misused among the userbase for [[open_jacket|open]] or partially-open jackets that are worn hanging off the upper arms, regardless of how they were designed to be worn.

title: zettai_ryouiki
body:
Zettai ryouiki (lit. "absolute territory") is the area of bare [[thighs]] seen between a [[skirt]] or [[short dress]] and [[thighhighs]]. The skirt should not be [[skirt lift|lifted up]] or out of place; the thighs should be exposed naturally, by the skirt being too short to cover the tops of the thighhighs. Example characters include [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[Momose Kurumi]] and [[Mayura]]. 

The term itself originates from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], although it had none of the current connotations in the anime. The modern usage of zettai ryouiki originates from the creator of a desktop mascot application when he used the term on his blog in reference to [[Mayura]]. 

Do not use this tag for [[single thighhigh]], [[shorts]], or when the [[panties]], [[underwear]], or genitalia are visible beneath the skirt. [[Thigh boots]] may however still apply.

h4. Examples

* !post #933691
* !post #70643

* !post #877293

title: little_boy_(bomb)
body:
A uranium-infused [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] developed by the United States as a part of the Manhattan Project. It was used during the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima]] on 6 August, 1945, destroying the city in the process. Little Boy is the first nuclear weapon to ever be used in warfare.

Little Boy can be distinguished from its relative [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] by the more cylindrical shape of the bomb casing, as opposed to the more round shape of Fat Man's.

h4. See also
* [[Fat Man (bomb)]]

title: hashima_island
body: A small island located off the coast of [[Nagasaki]], Japan. It is commonly known as "Gunkanjima" (battleship island) due to its usage as a fortification and forced labor camp during World War II.

title: nagasaki
body:
A mountainous coastal city in southern island of Kyushu, [[Japan]], being the capital of the namesake prefecture. The city is a historical trading hub during the 16th century and being one of the earliest hubs of [[Christianity]] in the country.

It was the second city attacked during the [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] that ended [[World War II]]. The bombing ocurred in August 9, 1945. The [[B-29 superfortress]] [[bomber]] [i]Bockscar[/i] dropped the atomic bomb "[[Fat Man (bomb)|]]", a 5 short ton Plutonium device with a blast yield of 21 kilotons, in the early morning of that day.

h4.See also
* [[Hashima island]] - aka "Gunkanjima/Battleship island"
* [[Hiroshima]]

The character made a single appearance in Spider-Man Annual Vol 3. In June 2023, the character saw a boost in virality on sites including Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram, inspiring memes and fan art depicting him.

title: bomb_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The Bomb Devil is a devil that embodies the fear of bombs.

[[Reze (chainsaw man)|]]'s transformation is that of a black blimp-shaped head with multiple fins on the end, resembling the atomic bombs. Consistent with other hybrid transformations, her teeth are always visible and are notably sharp and angular. Bomb fuses cover her arms like sleeves while also making up a portion of her apron along with sticks of dynamite.

Use tag when [[Reze (chainsaw man)|]] is in her Bomb Devil Hybrid form. Do [b]NOT[/b] tag [[nuclear weapon]] on posts featuring Bomb Devil simply because she has a nuke-like head, unless there's an actual nukes in the image.

title: school_bag
body:
A catchall tag for school [[bag]]s used by Japanese students. There are two major styles: the traditional style, which looks like a [[briefcase]], and the modern style, which looks like a small blue [[shoulder bag]].

The traditional style, used by middle and high school students, looks like a [[briefcase]] with a rigid flat front and back, and a single large flap that goes over the top with a handle on the top. It may also have a shoulder strap, but this is rarely depicted. Additionally, this style of bag can also have a strap fastened on the back and can be worn like a [[backpack]].

The modern style looks like a small blue sports bag or duffel bag, with a zipper on the top and a strap on each side. The straps are typically big enough to be worn over the shoulder like a [[shoulder bag]], or sometimes on the back like a [[backpack]].

[[Randoseru]] ([[backpack]]s used by elementary school students) should not be tagged [[school bag]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5230194: Modern style
* !post #2097068: Traditional style

title: survivor_guilt
body:
A type of [[PTSD]] found in person who have survived a life-threatening situation. Individuals who believe it is unfair that they survived when others died and/or believe they did not do enough to save the lives of others may come to experience survivor guilt after trauma or a catastrophic event.

Symptoms of survivor guilt typically include nightmares, difficulty sleeping, flashbacks to the traumatic event, loss of motivation, irritability, a sense of numbness, and thoughts about the meaning of life.

The [[esso crumb cat (meme)|]] meme is based on it.

title: mxy-7_ohka
body:
The [b]Yokosuka MXY-7 [i]Ohka ([[cherry_blossoms|Cherry Blossom]])[/i][/b] was a rocket-powered, single-pilot, suicide [[rocket]] flying bomb employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during late [[World War II]]. It was flown by [[kamikaze pilot]]s.

Relatively simple to manufacture, and requiring only minimally-trained operators, this "rocket with a cockpit" was extremely hard to shoot down due to its very high speed. Though due to its limited range, the Ohka was usually carried by the slow and large [[G4M]] bombers, which severely limited its effectiveness, as many G4Ms were shot down before being able to deliver the vehicle.

American soldiers nicknamed this aircraft the [i]"Baka"[/i] (literally "idiot" in Japanese).

h4. See also
* [[Kaiten (weapon)]]
* [[The Cockpit: Sonic Boom Squadron]]

title: symmetrical_docking
body:
When [[2girls|two girls]] [[breast press|press their breasts]] (of roughly equal size) against each other. If there is a noticeable size difference, it is [[asymmetrical docking]] instead.

The term originates from [[Yuusha ou GaoGaiGar]], in which the [[gattai|combined]] [[fusion|form]] of [[Hyouryuu (gaogaigar)|]] and [[Enryuu (gaogaigar)|]], Chouryujin, was released through a maneuver called "symmetrical docking" (post #132179). Later, other similar paired [[mecha]] performed the same combining maneuver.

In a [[Super Robot Wars]] [[4koma]] (post #150779), the maneuver was likened to the action the tag now stands for.

If the breast(s) are [[breast rest|resting]] on top of each other instead of being pushed against each other please use [[breast on breast]] instead.

title: shenyang_j-31
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-31[/b], rumored to be nicknamed "Gyrfalcon" (鹘鹰), or [i]Falcon Eagle[/i] by some military enthusiasts, is a twin-engine, mid-size fifth-generation fighter [[jet]]  currently under development by [i]Shenyang Aircraft Corporation[/i] for the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]]. 

The fighter has also been referred to as [b]F-60[/b] (Official Chinese military code name of the export variant) or [b]J-21 Snowy Owl[/b] (雪鸮) in some International media reports.

It is very similar to the American [[F-35 Lightning II]], but is equipped with two engines instead of one and lacks any [[VTOL]] capacity.

h4. See also
